q: The Times begins its story with Donald Rumsfeld 's account about being told by George W. Bush two weeks after the 9/11 attacks, to prepare review the Pentagon's plans for a war with Iraq. According to the Times: `` Two weeks after the worst terrorist attack in our nation's history, those of us in the Department of Defense were fully occupied, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld recalls. But the George W. Bush insisted on new military plans for Iraq, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld writes.`` He wanted the options to be` creative.''' " Reactions are starting to come in

She said: If ever there was a guy who tells it like it is, then it's Simon Cowell . You could definitely look at Sue and say there's a lot of Simon Cowell in her.`` He's a great inspiration for the character of Sue- there is a lot that I can take from him and put into her. source told the newspaper:`` Simon Cowell desperately wants Cheryl to be a judge but if that's knocked back by Fox chiefs the next option is to start her as a mentor.'' They added: It would be a way to test how she's received in America. Plus viewers would be able to warm to her first, rather than having her thrust upon them by going straight on the panel. While Cheryl may still have a job on US X Factor, title="Sean Combs" href="http://www.mtv.co.uk/artists/p-Sean Combs"> Sean Combs has claimed that he is`` not interested'' in becoming a judge on the show.
